questions.text: Children start sitting in a tripod position first at the age of
questions.explanation:
Solution:

6 months Children first start sitting with support at about 5 months. They gradually sit with their arms forward for support (tripod position) by about 6 months, but can sit without support by the age of 8 months.

questions.text: A child has recently learned to walk without support and creep on stairs. He can jargon, but not form sentences. Considering him to be developmentally normal, which of these additional milestones is likely to be present in this child?
questions.correct_answer: C. Build a tower of 2 cubes
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Build a tower of 2 cubes Children can walk without support by 13-15 months; creep on stairs by 15 months; and jargon by 15 months. This child appears to have a developmental age of 15 months. He is not able to form sentences (which is possible by 2 years of age). Children run on level ground by 18 months; climb stairs starting at 2 years; know their gender by 3 years; and build a tower of 2 cubes by 15 months.

questions.text: Absence of which of these milestones will engender the greatest concern in a 6-month-old child?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vocalization The child should start vocalizing by 1-2 months of age. The absence of vocalization at 6 months is a reason for concern. 6 months is also the upper limit of the age of attainment of this milestone. Sitting starts from about 5-6 months; standing from 9 months; and transferring objects by 6-7 months.

questions.text: What is the time of the first attainment of this milestone shown in the Image
questions.explanation:
Solution:

15-18 months The Image shows a child scribbling. Children first are able to scribble by 15-18 months of age.

questions.text: What is the earliest age of attainment of this milestone shown in the Image
questions.explanation:
Solution:

6 months The Image shows a child holding objects Palmar grasp, first attained at 6 months of age

questions.text: A child is able to copy a cross, build a bridge but not a gate with blocks, make a tower of 10 cubes, and walk alternate feet on stairs. What is the approximate developmental age of the child?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

4 years Children can copy a cross at 4 years; build a bridge with blocks at 4 years and a gate with blocks at 5 years; make a tower of 10 cubes at 3 years and walk alternate feet on stairs at 4 years. Therefore, the child’s developmental age is 4 years.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is wrong about breast milk (compared to cow’s milk)?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Higher proteins Breast milk has high carbohydrate (lactose) content compared to cow’s milk; i.e. 6-7 gm/dl. Fat content is almost equivalent compared to cow’s milk, e. 4 gm/dl. The protein content of breast milk is lower than that in cow’s milk, i.e. about 1 gm/dl. The predominant protein in breast milk is whey protein, while the predominant protein in cow’s milk is casein.

questions.text: Milk ejection reflex is regulated by which of these hormones?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Oxytocin The milk secretion reflex is regulated by prolactin, resulting in the stimulation of milk secretion. On the other hand, the milk ejection reflex is controlled by oxytocin, wherein the milk is primarily secreted from the alveolar glands into the lactiferous sinuses.

questions.text: Which of the following is a correct statement about foremilk?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

High in protein content Milk that is secreted in the initial part of lactation is known as foremilk; while that secreted during the latter part of lactation is known as hind milk . Foremilk is rich in proteins, sugars, minerals, and vitamins; while hind milk is rich in fat content.

questions.text: A mother expresses concern that due to her hectic professional life, she is not able to breastfeed her baby. She enquires if she can express her breast milk and if the same can be given to her child safely. You suggest that she expressed breast milk when stored at room temperature can be given to the baby if stored not beyond:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

6-8 hours Expressed breast milk can be stored at room temperature for up to 6-8 hours; in a refrigerator for up to 24 hours; and in a freezer at 20 o C for up to 3 months.

questions.text: In most children, temper tantrums subside by the age of:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

3-6 years Temper tantrums are common in children. They improve with advancing age. In most children, they start by of age and subside by 3-6 years of age. 18-36 months

questions.text: A 20-month-old boy was brought to the emergency with a history of rapid onset of cyanosis after an episode of excessive crying followed by holding his breath in full expiration. A similar episode was witnessed by the mother 2 weeks back, again precipitated by excessive anger and crying in the child. There is no history of seizures in the family. An Electroencephalogram (ECG) performed in the emergency was normal. The child resumed normal activities in the emergency. An Electroencephalogram (EEG)performed later was also normal. What is your next investigation/management approach?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Reassurance and education This is most likely a breath-holding spell in the child.

Highyeild:

These are often precipitated by stimuli such as anger, frustration, or fear and result in the child crying vigorously followed by holding their breath in full expiration. They are uncommon before 6 months of age, peak by 2 years of age, and subside by 5 years. A detailed history is important to rule out other more serious disorders which can mimic these symptoms. Treatment is primarily reassurance and education.
